TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Take Benzoic acid and 2-Naphthol mixture in a beaker.
Add 10 ml, of a saturated solution which contains 10% of sodium bicarbonate [cml](NaHCO[sub]3[/sub])[/cml] to the mixture.
Stir the mixture well using a clean glass rod.
Take the beaker.
Simple filtration Method: Place a filter funnel on a funnelstand.
Keep a filter paper on the mouth of the filter funnel.
Take a fresh beaker.
Hold the filter paper using a glass rod.
Pour the mixture through the funnel to the beaker.
Once it filtered completely, take out the filter funnel.
Collect the residue (2-Naphthol) in a watch glass using a spatula.
Thus 2-Naphthol is separated out.
Take the remaining filtrate collected in the beaker.
notext
Add few drops of conc.HCl to the filtrate.
Stir the mixture well using a clean glass rod.
Dip the red litmus paper in the filtrate to test the acidification (Litmus paper test). We can observe that red litmus turns blue.
After some time benzoic acid will be precipitated out.
Take the beaker.
Filter the filtrate using simple filter method, as shown earlier.
Once it filtered completely, take out the filter funnel.
Collect the residue (Benzoic acid) in a watch glass using a spatula.
Thus 2-Naphthol and Benzoic Acid is separated out.
notext
Take Naphthalene and Benzoic acid mixture in a beaker
Add 10 ml, of a saturated solution which contains 10% of sodium bicarbonate [cml](NaHCO[sub]3[/sub])[/cml] to the mixture.
Stir the mixture well using a clean glass rod.
Take the beaker.
Simple filtration Method: Place filter funnel on a funnelstand.
Keep a filter paper on the mouth of the filter funnel.
Take a fresh beaker.
Hold the filter paper using a glass rod.
Pour the mixture through the funnel to the beaker.
Once it filtered completely, take out the filter funnel.
Collect the residue (Naphthalene) in a watch glass using a spatula.
Thus Naphthalene is separated.
Take the remaining filtrate in the beaker.
Add few drops of conc.HCl to the filtrate.
Stir the mixture well using a clean glass rod.
Dip the red litmus paper in the filtrate to test the acidification (Litmus paper test). We can observe that red litmus turns blue.
After some time benzoic acid will be precipitated out.
Take the beaker.
Filter the filtrate using simple filter method, as shown earlier.
Once the mixture is filtered, take out the funnel.
The residue (Benzoic acid) is collected in a watch glass using a spatula.
Thus Naphthalene and Benzoic Acid are separated.
notext
Take Aniline and Toluene in a beaker.
Add 15 ml dil.Hcl acid to the mixture.
Stir the mixture well using a glass rod.
Take the mixture in the beaker.
Take a separation funnel.
Place one filter funnel on the mouth of the separation funnel.
Pour the mixture into the separation funnel.
Remove the filter funnel.
Close the separation funnel using a stopper.
Shake the funnel and keep it on the stand for some time.
We can observe that liquid separates into two layers; an upper layer of organic solution and a lower layer of aqueous solution.
Remove the stopper.
Carefully drain out the lowest aqueous layer to a fresh beaker.
notext
Add a few drops of NaOH to the filtrate.
Stir it well using a clean glass rod.
Dip a blue litmus paper in the filtrate, It turns red (litmus paper test).
notext
Take a fresh separation funnel and pour the filtrate through a filter funnel.
Add 15 ml of Ether.
Remove the filter funnel
Close the separation funnel using a stopper
Shake it well and keep it on the stand for some time.
Observe for some time.
Aniline reacts with Ether and separates it as organic layer.
Remove the stopper.
Carefully drain out the lowest aqueous layer.
Similarly, drain out the organic layer in another beaker.
Heat the organic solution using a heating mantle, set the temperature as 40ºC. Ether will get evaporated and Aniline will be left over.
Drain out the organic layer from the first separation funnel to a fresh beaker.
Add some [cml]CaCl[sub]2 into the mixture to remove any moisture content. CaCl2[/sub][/cml] does not dissolve, instead it get settle down at the bottom of the beaker.
notext
Take Toluene and Benzic Acid in a beaker.
Pour 10 ml of NaOH in to the mixture.
Stir it well using glass rod.
notext
Take a separation funnel.
Place a filter funnel on top of it.
Pour the mixture of toluene and Benzoic Acid in to the separation funnel.
Remove the filter funnel.
Close the separation funnel using stopper.
Shake it and allow the funnel to stand for some time.
The liquid separates in to two layers.
Remove stopper.
Carefully run out the lower aqueous layer containing the sodium salt of acid in to a clean beaker.
Take out the funnel from the stand and add 6 ml of NaOH solution.
Close funnel using stopper, shake it well and place it again in the stand.
Collect the aqueous layer in the same beaker.
notext
Regenerate benzoic acid by adding HCl to the aqueous layer.
Stir it well using glass rod.
Litmus test: red litmus will turnes to blue.
Benzoic acid appear as ppt
notext
Separate Benzoic acid using simple filteration.
Separate Benzoic acid using simple filteration. Pour the mixture through the filter funnel, benzoic acid will be collected in the funnel.
Take the funnel out.
Collect solid benzoic acid from the funnel using spatula.
Drain toluene in to a clean dry beaker.
Add anhydrous [cml]CaCl[sub]2[/sub][/cml] to remove traces of water.
notext
Take Phenol and Toluene in a beaker
Add 10 ml of NaOH to the mixture using a measuring jar.
Stir it well using a glass rod.
notext
Take a separation funnel.
Place a filter funnel on the mouth of the separation funnel.
Pour the mixture into the separation funnel through the filter funnel.
Remove the filter funnel.
Close the funnel using a glass stopper.
Shake it well and keep it on the stand for some time.
We can observe that, the mixture in the funnel gets separated as two layers. Phenol at the top organic layer and toluene at the lower aqueous layer.
Remove the stopper.
Carefully drain out the lower aqueous layer into a beaker.
notext
Add few drops of NaOH to the solution.
Stir it well using glass rod.
Dip a red litmus paper in the solution, red litmus turns blue.
notext
Take a new separation funnel.
Place a filter funnel on the mouth of the test tube.
Pour the filtrate into the funnel.
Add 20 ml of ether into the filtrate.
Remove the filter funnel.
Close the funnel with a stopper.
Shake it well and keep it on the stand for some time.
Phenol reacts with Ether and separates it out as upper organic layer. Lower aqueous layer is water.
Remove the stopper and drain out the water (Lower aqueous layer).
Collect the organic layer to a fresh beaker.
Heat the organic solution using a heating mantle. Set the temperature to 40ºC. Ether evaporates out and thus Toluene is separated out.
Collect the organic layer from the first separation funnel to a fresh beaker.
Add some anhydrous [cml]CaCl[sub]2[/sub][/cml] to remove the traces of water.
notext
Take some Ortho Nitro Phenol and Para Nitro Phenol in a round bottom flask.
Add some water into it.
Place the RB flask in a heating mantle.
Take another round bottom flask, place it on a tripod stand.
Keep a filter funnel on the mouth of the RB flask.
Fill some water till the neck of the RB flask.
Remove the funnel.
Insert a cork.
Insert a glass tube into the RB flask.
Place an adapter on top of the RB flask in the heating mantle.
Attach a condenser and then a receiver as shown.
Place a conical flask filled with ice to collect the vapours.
Insert another glass tube to the RB flask on the tripod stand.
Insert a glass cork and then a glass tube through it into the RB flask in the heating mantle.
Connect the two flasks using a tube as shown.
Attach two tubes to the two outlets of the condenser and turn on the tap.
The condenser gets filled with water.
If you carefully observe, the water passes through the tube, fills the condenser and then comes out through one of the outlet. This process is to condense the condenser.
Set the temparature of heating mandle to 93ºC, turn on the burner too.
The Water vapour rises up and the conical flask gets filled with a green colour salt.

If you carefully observe, Water vapour rises up from the RB flask on the tripod stand, passes through the tube, enters the second RB flask and now the O-Nitro Phenol vapour rises up and passes through the condenser and get collected in the receiver conical flask in the solid form as shown.
Here, the O-Nitro Phenol vapour, when gets into the condenser get converted into liquid form due to condensation and get collected in the solid form in the conical flask due to the ice filled in it.
Take the conical flask.
Clamp a side arm conical flask to funnel stand.
Place a Buchner funnel on the mouth of the flask.
Put a piece of filter paper to the funnel.
Connect the thick wire of a hand vacuum pump to the side arm of the flask.
Put the green salt along with the ice to the flask, the pistol of the pump should be squeezed along with it. The water gets filled in the flask due to the vacuum filtration.
Take out the filter paper. We can observe that a thick layer of Ortho-Nitro Phenol is collected in the filter paper.
notext
Take Cyclohexane and Toluene mixture in a round bottom flask. Put some porcelain pieces in it to avoid bumping while boiling.
Place the RB flask in a heating mantle.
Fix a fractionating column and an adapter on top of the RB flask.
Fit a thermometer in a thermometer cork and place it on the adapter.
Attach a condenser to the adapter and a then a receiver to the condenser.
Fix a round bottom flask in a stand.
Attach two tubes to the two outlets of the condenser as shown and then open the tap.
The condenser gets filled with water.
If you carefully observe, the water passes through the tube, fills the condenser and then come out through one of the outlet. This process is to condense the condenser.
Set the temperature to 82ºC on the heating mantle.

Cyclohexane evaporates, vapours rise through the column, while it passes through the condenser, condensation takes place and therefore Cyclohexane vapour gets collected in liquid form in the RB flask.
Cyclohexane has the lower boiling point (80ºC) and is more volatile. Toluene does not boil at the same temperature as Cyclohexane, so the Cyclohexane will boil out of the mixture first.
notext
Benzene will be sparated and collected in the receiving flask.
Take a column,fix it in a stand and plug a small amount of cotton in it.
Take a wood applicator to tamp the cotton down.
Place a conical flask below the column.
Take some dry Silica Gel in a clean conical flask.
Pour some Petroleum Ether into it.
Stir it well using a glass rod until the mixture becomes slurry.
Insert a grass rod and pour the slurry in to the column.
Take a clean conical flask.
Put 4-grams of mixture of O-nitro phenol and P-nitro phenol in to the conical flask
Take some Dichloro Methane in a measuring jar.
Pour this Dichloro Methane into the conical flask contains the mixture.
Put some Silica Gel into the mixture.
Shake it well, the Dichloro Methane gets evaporated.
Take the dust in a weighing paper.
Put it into the column.
plug in a cotton.
Tamp it tightly using a wood applicator.
Pour some Dichloro Methane in a dropping funnel.
Place the funnel on top of the column.
Open the stopcock of the dropping funnel.
If you carefully observe, we can see O-Nitro Phenol and P-Nitro Phenol separates into two layers.
Take a fresh conical flask run out the Ortho-Nitro Phenol.
notext
Similarly run out the Para-Nitro Phenol from the column.
notext
Transfer O-Nitro phenol into a RB flask and evoporate the solution using rotary evaporator.
Scratch out the dry O-Nitro phenol from the RB flask using a spatula.
Transfer P-Nitro phenol into a RB flask and evoporate the solution using rotary evaporator.
Scratch out the dry P-Nitro phenol from the RB flask using a spatula.
Take Ethanol and Water mixture in a round bottom flask. Put some porcelain pieces in it to avoid bumping while boiling.
Place the RB flask in a heating mantle.
Fix a fractionating column and an adapter on top of the RB flask.
Fit a thermometer in a thermometer cork and place it on the adapter.
Attach a condenser to the adapter and a then a receiver to the condenser.
Fix a round bottom flask in a stand.
Attach two tubes to the two outlets of the condenser as shown and turn on the tap.
The condenser gets filled with water.
If you carefully observe, the water passes through the tube, fills the condenser and then comes out through one of the outlet. This process is to condense the condenser.
Set the temperature to 78.4ºC on the heating mantle.
Ethanol evaporates, the vapours rise through the column, while it passes through the condenser, condensation takes place and therefore Ethanol vapours gets collected in liquid form in the RB flask.

Ethanol has the lower boiling point (78ºC) than the water. Because ethanol is more volatile, the vapours contain more ethanol. This process has to be repeated many times before the collected liquid consist of only pure ethanol.
notext
